title: Why $600 Checks Are Tearing Republicans Apart
description:
A fight has erupted among congressional Republicans over how long and how generously the government should help those unemployed during the pandemic. But what is that battle really about? Guest: Nicholas Fandos, who covers Congress for The New York Times. For more information on today’s episode, visit nytimes.com/thedaily

Background reading:

  • Supplemental checks for laid-off workers are set to stop at the end of July. Republicans and Democrats disagree on what to do next.
  • Why the two parties are unlikely to reach a deal before the end of the month.
author: thedaily@nytimes.com (The New York Times)
